intro: Brachysema undulatum var. angustifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leafed brachysema, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
